title: NumPy: Sum Along Axes
story: Understanding axes is crucial for multi-dimensional operations. Axis 0 goes down rows, axis 1 goes across columns.
instructions: Create 2D array [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]. Calculate sum along axis 0 (column sums) and print the result.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Sum along axis 0 (column-wise)
arr = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
result = arr.sum(axis=0)
print(result)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

arr = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
result = arr.sum(axis=0)
print(result)

hints.text: Use arr.sum(axis=0) to sum along rows (producing column sums).
Axis 0 collapses rows: [1,4] sums to 5, [2,5] to 7, [3,6] to 9.
